snippet: Prime Minister Theresa May told the chief executive of General Motors, Mary Barra, that she wanted to see jobs at two Vauxhall car plants in Britain secured for the long term during a phone call on Sunday, May's office said in a statement....

headline.main: Are High Heel Dress Codes Sexist? UK Lawmakers Hold Debate
headline.print_headline: Are High Heel Dress Codes Sexist? UK Lawmakers Hold Debate

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Theresa May told the chief executive of General Motors, Mary Barra, that she wanted to see jobs at two Vauxhall car plants in Britain secured for the long term during a phone call on Sunday, May's office said in a statement.
